turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Buffy the Vampire Slayer Collectible Card Game.
turn.1: What are the rules for a start playing deck?
turn.2: No more than half of the deck can be action cards, and no more than half of the deck can be character decks.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: There is a limit of 3 of any given card, and only 3 character cards per level per character are permitted (so that one cannot have 4 different level 1 Buffy cards).
turn.5: What are some of the cards that are needed for a start playing deck?
turn.6: Each deck must also have one Hero/Villain Essence Card, along with a corresponding Level 1 character card.
turn.7: What is the name of the starter deck?
turn.8: The 200-card "Buffy the Vampire Slayer Collectible Card Game" base set is known as the "Pergamum Prophecy".
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: Two expansions were also produced: "Angel's Curse" and "Class of '99".
turn.12: The former featured cards involving Buffy struggling against her vampiric ex-boyfriend, while the latter introduced "episode cards" to the game system.
